title: Campbell's Cheesy Chicken and Rice Casserole Recipe
description: This chicken, cheese, and rice casserole is loaded with mixed vegetables for a hearty and flavorsome meal the whole family will enjoy!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Dinner Campbell's Cheesy Chicken and Rice Casserole 4.2 (407) 329 Reviews 82 Photos This vegetable, chicken, cheese, and rice casserole is an easy-to-prep, one-dish meal! Submitted by Campbell's Kitchen Updated on September 15, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 82 82 82 82 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 45 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 6 Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings 2 cups fresh or frozen vegetables 1 (10.5 ounce) can Campbell's® Condensed Cream of Chicken Soup (regular or 98% Fat Free) 1 ⅓ cups water ¾ cup uncooked regular long-grain white rice ½ teaspoon onion powder 4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts ½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese Directions Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Mix vegetables, condensed soup, water, rice, and onion powder together in a 12x8-inch shallow baking dish. Arrange chicken breasts on top; cover. Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink and cooked through, about 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Top with shredded cheese and serve. Variations: Italian: In place of onion powder, use 1 teaspoon of Italian seasoning. Substitute 1/3 cup shredded Parmesan for Cheddar. Mexican: In place of onion powder, use 1 teaspoon chili powder. Substitute Mexican cheese blend for Cheddar. I Made It Print 887 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Campbell's Cheesy Chicken and Rice Casserole 01 of 82 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 82 Photo by  Sydney Taylor 09/27/2023 This recipe was pretty good! Definitely would have been bland without adding extra seasoning - doubled the onion powder, and added a teaspoon of garlic powder, plus salt and pepper. Also added extra of these spices/seasonings on top of the chicken as it would have been extremely bland without. Needed extra time to cook the chicken through, about an extra 10 minutes. Was also very soupy when I took it out the first time so did the extra cook time uncovered. Also added extra cheese and put it back in the oven after to melt the cheese. I used corn as my frozen veggie if that helps :) 03 of 82 Photo by  avmill 07/11/2021 04 of 82 Photo by  Kerry Ramsdell 05/15/2021 I loved it and definitely recommend this tasty recipe to anyone. 05 of 82 Photo by  Steven 05/04/2021 Very easy to make and so delicious. I added a little more veggies and seasoning. It's now one of my favorite meals. 06 of 82 Photo by  Miranda Oliva 03/31/2021 07 of 82 Photo by  Crystal 03/08/2021 08 of 82 Photo by  Lenalady 02/28/2021 09 of 82 Photo by  tesembermarie 01/25/2021 10 of 82 Photo by  Mama 01/07/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love One Dish Chicken and Rice Bake 250 Ratings Chicken, Rice, and Biscuit Casserole 84 Ratings Chicken and Rice Casserole 26 Ratings Hearty Chicken and Noodle Casserole 131 Ratings Cheesy Chicken Casserole Homey Chicken and Rice Casserole 165 Ratings Cheesy Chicken and Corn Casserole 1 Rating Cheesy Chicken and Rice Casserole 272 Ratings Super Veggie Chicken and Wild Rice Casserole 9 Ratings Chicken, Rice, and Green Bean Casserole 55 Ratings Crunchy Chicken Casserole with Mayo 81 Ratings Salsa Chicken Rice Casserole 1,715 Ratings Easy Creamy Chicken and Rice Casserole 1 Rating Oh-So-Good Chicken 757 Ratings Creamy Almond Chicken Bake 5 Ratings Campbell's Kitchen Easy Chicken Pot Pie 134 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Campbell's Kitchen
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).;Mix vegetables, condensed soup, water, rice, and onion powder together in a 12x8-inch shallow baking dish. Arrange chicken breasts on top; cover.;Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink and cooked through, about 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Top with shredded cheese and serve.
